Articles.Content:
So uh... hows this working with .24.2?

i get firespitter dll incompatabilty error, but i record no problems so far.

I have a feeling that it's not SP+ related. In my experience transitions from ladder to ladder get iffy whenever the angle between them is much greater than 45 degrees in any single direction. Not sure about combined rotations, as I generally try to keep the angle change from ladder to ladder to a minimum anyways. If you have to have that ladder going straight down, I would suggest using a small stationary ladder to act as a transition between the pod's ladder and the telescopic one.

That did it, though it looks awkward as hell. Perhaps what might fix the issue is if there were a short and slightly angled invisible ladder surface baked into the part itself. Using the longer ladder part and angling it also works.

Hello, I would like to know if there are any masters needed for this except for firespitter. As when I add this to the Gamedata and start the game the modulemanager 2.2.0 says 101 hidden items.

EDIT: Never mind, sorted it. Just removed the SP+NEAR, DED, FAR... All is good now

Edited July 28, 2014 by IPsoFreely
This doesn't seem to work for me. I'm running 64-bit KSP. When I try going to the runway from the spacecenter, KSP crashes. This only happens with Spaceplane Plus. After I remove it, KSP runs fine.
On the imgur album, there is a shot from inside the cabin behind the kerbals. Is there a way to get these kinds of shots normally?

On the imgur album, there is a shot from inside the cabin behind the kerbals. Is there a way to get these kinds of shots normally?

Yes. The way I was able to do it was by looking all the way back (I believe I had double clicked on the left-most window allowing me to see the back of the cabin) and double clicking on that location.
Anyone have issues with the cameras not being integrated into the cockpit with RPM and MFD installed? I used to have the cameras that were part of the cockpit but now I don't.
I think the cameras were removed

Sorry If it was already said in the 73 pages before.

During my intention to create a KSO replica of the one that was created by sharpspoonful, I encountered a Problem. First I was blaming KSO mod for the problem but then I tested it more, and got a totally strange result.

Has anyone else encountered this? What I mean is the center of lift that is out of centre, with a completly symmetrical plane.

Has anyone else encountered this? What I mean is the center of lift that is out of centre, with a completly symmetrical plane.

Yes, I've had the same problem too. I would just take the wings off and slap 'em back in place and it would solve the problem. But as soon as I added some other part such as solar panel or battery it would shift the CoL to the right just like that. Is that a thing with FAR perhaps?

I've had that before without SP+ - basically, the SPH symmetry bugs out. Unfortunately, the craft file gets corrupted and the vessel needs to be scrapped and rebuilt. It's not a SP+ issue per se, just that it can happen to its parts. As well as stock parts, mind you.

So, I'm also getting crashes. I got it to work once on start up, but before and after that, it always crashes after getting through the main menu and resuming my game. I'm running it on 64-bit, so I don't think it's a memory crash (but I don't know what the ceiling is for KSP 64-bit).

Here's the crash part of the output log. Hopefully it'll shed some light on this?

Crash!!!
